required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Characteristics and Clinical Outcomes of Anorexia Nervosa : Siriraj Hospital Experience
clinical_study.official_title: Characteristics and Clinical Outcomes of Anorexia Nervosa : Siriraj Hospital Experience

brief_summary.textblock: This study is aimed to determine clinical characteristics of patients with anorexia nervosa and outcome of treatment at Sirirraj Hospital.

detailed_description.textblock: Data is derived from the medical records

primary_outcome.measure: types and factors contributing to outcomes of anorexia nervosa

secondary_outcome.measure: Outcome of treatment of anorexia nervosa
secondary_outcome.description: By using core symptoms (bodyweight, menstruation, and eating behavior), outcome can be categorized into 4 groups, which are recovery, improvement, chronicity, and death.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children and adolescents with newly diagnosed anorexia nervosa in Siriraj Hospiatl according to DSM IV criteria
- treated by multidisciplinary teams e.g. pediatricians specialized in nutrition and psychology and psychologist
Exclusion Criteria:
- none

facility.name: Faculty of Medicine Siriraj Hospital, Mahidol University

reference.citation: Nakai Y, Nin K, Noma S, Hamagaki S, Takagi R, Wonderlich SA. Outcome of eating disorders in a Japanese sample: a 4- to 9-year follow-up study. Eur Eat Disord Rev. 2014 May;22(3):206-11. doi: 10.1002/erv.2290. Epub 2014 Mar 14.

results_reference.citation: Goldstein MA, Dechant EJ, Beresin EV. Eating disorders. Pediatr Rev. 2011 Dec;32(12):508-21. doi: 10.1542/pir.32-12-508. Review.
